div.p: DISPLACE something VIOLENTLY TOWARDS something, OFTEN IN-ORDER-TO DAMAGE IT.
1. The current general word for striking against anything is jī 擊. Compare the late dǎ 打 which remains exceedingly rare in pre-Buddhist times.
2. Bó 搏, ōu 毆 refer to boxing someone or beating him up.
3. Tà 撻 and zhuā 撾 refer to beating someone with sticks or whips.
4. Chī 笞, chuí 捶 refer specifically to beating someone with a stick. See PUNISH
5. Pū 扑 is to cane someone, often in a domestic context, and this is currently mentioned together with biān 鞭 "flaying".
6. Qiāo 敲, chuāng 撞, and pī 批 refer to beating against a physical object of any kind. See KNOCK
7. Pì 擗 refers specifically to beating one's breast.
8. Biān 鞭 refers specifically to striking someone with a leather whip, typically by way of an official non-domestic punishment. See FLAY for other words with related meanings.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Novyj objasnitel'nyj Slovar' Sinonimov Russkogo Jazyka
A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: verberare refers to striking in general, by throwing, hitting or pushing.
caedere is to strike with a weapon that cuts wounds, a hatched, sword, whip, rod or strap.
pulsare is to strike any object with a hard object.
mulcare refers to striking with fists or clubs aiming principlally at physical pain.

bibl.title: 東漢﹣隨常用詞演變研究

Handbook of Greek Synonymes, from the French of M. Alex. Pillon, Librarian of the Bibliothèque Royale , at Paris, and one of the editors of the new edition of Plaché's Dictionnaire Grec-Français, edited, with notes, by the Rev. Thomas Kerchever Arnold, M.A. Rector of Lyndon, and late fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge

sense.def: a beating; German: eine Tracht Pruegel

entry.def: Pū 扑 is to cane someone, often in a domestic context, and this is currently mentioned together with biān 鞭 "flaying".

sense.def: strike, beat with a cane or whip
punishment by beating with a rod

entry.def: Qiāo 敲, chuāng 撞, and pī 批 refer to beating against a physical object of any kind.

sense.def: to hit; to beat; to slap; to strike into
beat (a bell) [the addition of the hand radical is late]
hit a contextually determinate N with the palm of one's hand; slap somebody

entry.def: Chī 笞, chuí 捶 refer specifically to beating someone with a bamboo stick, typically as a punitive measure.
Chī 笞, chuí 捶 refer specifically to beating someone with a bamboo stick, typically as a punitive measure.

sense.def: beat with a stick (e.g. meat to make it tender)

entry.def: Bó 搏, ōu 毆 refer to boxing someone or beating him up.

sense.def: strike, lash at the contextually determinate N
hit; strike with the side of the hand; to slap
strike, slap a contextually determinate person

entry.def: Qiāo 敲, chuāng 撞, and pī 批 refer to beating against a physical object of any kind.

sense.def: strike at, launch a pointed attack against

entry.def: Tà 撻 and zhuā 撾 refer to beating someone with sticks or whips.
Tà 撻 and zhuā 撾 refer to beating someone with sticks or whips. See STRIKE.
The current general word for striking against anything is jī 擊. Compare the late dǎ 打which remains exceedingly rare in pre-Buddhist times.

sense.def: strike (as part of an attack on someone)
strike, beat (e.g. a dog, a horse, one's breast, or indeed a bell)

entry.def: Qiāo 敲, chuāng 撞, and pī 批 refer to beating against a physical object of any kind.

sense.def: verbal classifier: blows with the stick

entry.def: Bó 搏, ōu 毆 refer to boxing someone or beating him up.

sense.def: beat with one's fists; pound; beat and drive off

entry.def: Chī 笞, chuí 捶 refer specifically to beating someone with a stick.

sense.def: mete out the punishment of flogging
to flog, to whip; to cane
to hit (with a hoe), to hoe (the ground)

entry.def: Biān 鞭 refers specifically to striking someone with a leather whip, typically by way of an official non-domestic punishment. See FLAY.

sense.def: beat up the contextually determinate N
be thoroughly beaten up (with a stick)
strike dead, slap so that N dies
strike with a stick or whip
to strike N with one's hand, e.g. in order to remove dust from it
strike the contextually determinate N in order to get his/her confession
